item.title: Man who concealed drugs in pumpkins nabbed
item.description:
August 05, 2020 5:00 AM

A Singaporean man who concealed $30,000 worth of drugs, some of which were discovered in two pumpkins, was arrested for suspected drug trafficking activities on Monday.

item.title: Ex-NLB manager admits to graft involving $600k
item.description:
August 05, 2020 5:00 AM

A former manager of a National Library Board (NLB) department set up to spearhead its move into e-books and other digital resources has admitted to graft offences involving nearly $600,000.

item.title: Generation Grit: Challenges in his life spur him to give back to society
PM to deliver televised National Day message on Aug 9
item.description:
August 05, 2020 5:00 AM

Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong will be addressing the country in a televised message come Sunday, on National Day.

item.title: Businesses deliver cheer ahead of National Day
item.description:
August 05, 2020 5:00 AM

Donating masks to vulnerable communities, delivering meals to beneficiaries and rallying Singaporeans through a digital pledge map.

item.title: 10 arrested for allegedly riding PMDs, e-bikes dangerously on road
item.description:
August 05, 2020 5:00 AM

Ten people, aged between 16 and 25, have been arrested by the police for allegedly riding dangerously, after a video of them riding on personal mobility devices (PMDs) and power-assisted bicycles on the road surfaced online.

item.title: Social media impersonation scam cases continue to surge
item.description:
August 05, 2020 5:00 AM

Even before the middle of the year was up, the number of cases of social media impersonation scams here had already more than doubled in the span of two months.

item.title: New SPH site offers shoppers retail, F&B promotion codes and discounts
item.description:
August 05, 2020 5:00 AM

A new e-commerce platform offering shoppers promotional codes and discounts for their favourite brands and eateries has been launched by Singapore Press Holdings (SPH).

item.title: 19 weeks' jail for stalker who harassed woman
item.description:
August 05, 2020 5:00 AM

A man, smitten by his grandmother's neighbour, stalked the married woman from November 2016 to June 2017.

item.title: Pedestrians urged to keep left on shared paths in code of conduct
item.description:
August 05, 2020 5:00 AM

Pedestrians are urged to stay away, if possible, from paths they have to share with cyclists. But if they must use these shared paths, they are advised to keep left unless they are overtaking another pedestrian.

item.title: Former Fuji Xerox boss claims his dismissal was orchestrated
item.description:
August 05, 2020 5:00 AM

It was an anonymous letter by a whistle-blower accusing Fuji Xerox Singapore managing director Bert Wong of "bribery and criminal breach of trust" that triggered a special audit in 2017.

item.title: Coronavirus: Phase 2 has gone well but curbs must be lifted gradually, say experts
item.description:
August 05, 2020 5:00 AM

They are optimistic about further easing but warn that the risk of a second wave is still present.

item.title: Beach cleanup efforts boosted amid monsoon season
item.description:
August 05, 2020 5:00 AM

The tides are bringing trash to Singapore's southern coastlines.

item.title: Inmate with Covid-19 was jailed for overstaying in Singapore
item.description:
August 05, 2020 5:00 AM

The Sri Lankan prison inmate who was the sole community case on Monday had served a four-week jail sentence for overstaying in Singapore without a valid pass and was awaiting repatriation when he tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: 4 mosques gear up to receive more worshippers
item.description:
August 05, 2020 5:00 AM

Four mosques in Singapore will open additional entry and exit points or stagger the timings for arrivals and departures of congregants, in a move to prepare for more worshippers on Friday and keep them safe from Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singaporeans in Melbourne hunker down amid stricter, extended lockdown
item.description:
August 05, 2020 5:00 AM

Singaporean Dilpreet Singh, who runs a technology start-up in Melbourne, has been exercising regularly and checking in more often with his business team as he tries to keep spirits up while living under lockdown in the Australian city.

item.title: Bus route changes draw flak from MPs, residents
item.description:
August 05, 2020 5:00 AM

The planned changes to key bus services in Bukit Panjang - including the removal of two linking the area directly to the city - have touched a raw nerve among residents.

item.title: Sri Lankan inmate with Covid-19 was jailed for overstaying, hospitalised for dengue
item.description:
August 05, 2020 12:24 AM

SINGAPORE - The Sri Lankan prison inmate who was the sole community case on Monday (Aug 3) had served a four-week jail sentence for overstaying in Singapore without a valid pass and was awaiting repatriation when he tested positive for Covid-19.
